website_summaries.verdict: A great choice for colder weather, this heavy-duty wool blanket is naturally fire retardant, so it's great around the campfire.
pros: Made from 80 percent wool and 20 percent synthetic material
Resists static and mildew as well as flames

customer_reviews.title: ... too much experience with wool blankets but it feels nice. I bought this to turn into a jacket
customer_reviews.text: Don’t have too much experience with wool blankets but it feels nice. I bought this to turn into a jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Pekestyx

customer_reviews.title: Good and warm.
customer_reviews.text: Good warm blanket for use in house as a lap cover. Tight weave,good weight and warm:unlike what I can find locally.There is NO substitute for wool and when you use this blanket you will see that within minutes.Not much of a decor item but if you want warmth this is what you need.Generous size too so I can wrap under my feet and still have cover up to my chin and I'm 6' tall with size 13 feet. Used right out of the box and it does have a slight chemical smell from fire retardant treatment. That goes away with first wash.And blanket gets softer after same first wash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent blanket for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent blanket for the price. Slight "wooly" or some may say musty smell but not anywhere as bad as some of the discount wool blankets (i wont name any names Replica Swiss Wool Blanket that I had to return) Oops! Great hand feel and not itchy if at all. Very large, I am 6' 180lbs and this thing wraps me up like a burrito! Wish it was in a slightly brighter or cheerier color, either grey or red but hey for $22 cant complain. Will certainly be bringing it along camping and picnicking.
customer_reviews.author: The Big Bopper

customer_reviews.title: SUPERB BLANKET
customer_reviews.text: I bought these blankets for outdoor use (camping, etc.) and they more than met my needs. First, they WILL keep you warm - slept very comfortably under a tarp in low 20 degree temps with wind chill in the mid-teens with one of these blankets and a goretex bivy cover. Next, the blankets very closely resemble those I used in the military, which means to me they can/will take heavy use and (reasonable) abuse. Last, for my purposes, I didn't want or need "designer" labels or the latest high-tech innovation, with the price tag that matches. They are definitely not that, which in my opinion is a plus. They are, however, outstanding no-frills-get-the-job-done pieces of gear. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Russ T. Nayle

customer_reviews.title: good practical and inexpensive wool utility blanket
customer_reviews.text: I have the Ektos 80 and 90 pct wool blankets. Good to go. Bought four, brown, gray. When you wash them going to get a lot of lint in the wash/dry, if thru the dryers for fluffing, , and they will soften some too. No odor, no smell or irritation to skin, a little itchy, but wool is wool, unless alpaca blankets, that don't itch and are super soft, but fragile. Good product for little money. Note summer time prices vs winter time when demand increases. Good blanket, wear for cape, for any bag kit, car backup, or everyday on the bed. Good to go, IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Not regulation for inmate use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in January for an inmate at a NY correctional facility. It was regulation size, color and labelled fire retardant inmate was happy. Purchased a second one for a different inmate in need of a blanket and it no longer is labeled as fire retardant. So not only did I have to pay for return shipping from the facility I also had to pay Amazon for return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use as a dog bed. I love wool and am so happy to find something that is reasonably priced natural fiber for our doggie friends rather than the synthetic beds that are so readily available. We will be referring our clients, (we are a holistic breeder of service and therapy dogs.)
customer_reviews.author: 40 something CA country boy

customer_reviews.title: The heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: The awesomeness of this blanket is going to depend on how willing you are to carry it. At 3 plus pounds it is heavier than my tent. The blanket is nice and large and it is very warm. My intent was to put this blanket on the sleeping pad in my hammock to remove the need for an under quilt. It performs very will in that scenario. Overall I am very pleased with the blanket, it is nice to have something non-synthetic in your sleeping system be it in a tent or hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Virtual Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I used this blanket down to 44 degrees F on a car camping trip. It worked great. I highly recommend for Camping. Be sure to was it on gentle cycle using either Drift or woolite detergents. NOTHING ELSE. Also, you can dry on gently cycle. Just use one cycle then hang it up to complete the drying process. Be sure to empty the lint. this will release a lot of wool fibers during the first and second washes. DON"T USE MEDIUM or HIGH HEAT.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Harris

customer_reviews.title: Basic blanket - just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive wool under-layer for a queen-sized air mattress for a two week camping trip. This worked perfectly. The air mattress didn't feel chilly and clammy. The blanket itself is simple, and exactly what I needed. A little scratchy, and it shed lint, but I suspect the first time I wash it those problems will resolve themselves.
customer_reviews.author: JustKathi

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm BUT has a Strong chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t lightweight, it keeps you warm BUT it has a horrible chemical smell to it that even after washing, it still lingers. The worst part is that this chemical smell permeates into whatever material it comes into contact with. It also sheds a lot in the dryer but it does keep you warm if placed over a blanket & topped with a sheet. Unfortunately it causes us to itch a lot so I have had to sandwich it between a sheet & a blanket & only after 3 washes has the chemical smell toned down.
customer_reviews.author: Eliza

customer_reviews.title: Emergency blanket
customer_reviews.text: This is a inexpensive wool blanket that I keep in my trunk of car for emergencies. There is a slight odor and after washing it did create a LOT of lint. Very warm. After much research i couldn't find another blanket this size and this warm for the price. Side note, I have a Faribault Mill blanket that's 100% wool and the Ektos blanket is much warmer. But the wool is itchier that the Faribault. So I wouldn't use it on my bed for everyday sleeping. And it's not a pretty blanket... but perfect for keeping me warm in the car. And it will keep you dry if you're caught in rain.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart!
customer_reviews.text: The tag on the blanket says machine wash cold and to tumble dry low heat. so when it smelled a little off after shipping that is what I did. after washing on tap cold on delicate setting the blanket looked like it had been ripped to shreds! After drying for ten minutes cycles and then removing a full lint trap for over an hour, I decided that semi dry was enough. After letting it fully dry the blanket sheds a healthy layer of fluff every time it is moved. I cannot use this. Complete waste of money. do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Habig

customer_reviews.title: Worked as a wind block.
customer_reviews.text: I used this blanket as an inexpensive underquilt/wind block under my hammock. I hooked it to both ends of the hammock and had the sides drapped over top of me. It got down to 18°F that night and i was toasty warm. I was also using a military sleeping bag, but i had no wind coming through the bottom of the hammock and i definently had no heat loss. Military sleeping bag, sleeping pad, hammock, wool blanket. Worked rather well. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell C. Day

customer_reviews.title: Should have tried these first!
customer_reviews.text: A very nice lighter weight blanket for those cooler northern summer nights. Keep a couple in the car for ERs, backpacks, bug outs, and a nice blanket to cuddle up by the campfire. Inexpensive. Love it! I have 2 wool blankets in each car now. Not a lot of shedding, no strong odors.
customer_reviews.author: Assisting Future Stars

customer_reviews.title: The 80/20 blanket pills and sheds very badly.
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my 80/20 "wool blanket, ha, ha) just 3 weeks ago and actually thought I had found a real bargain. Much to my dismay I discover that the weave is very substandard and the blanket pills extensively....It will disintegrate after about 4 more washings. While it may look durable, don' be deceived ! For under $25 I should have known better.... Watch out..... Chuck C.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W Conner

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of searching before deciding to choose this particular blanket. I looked up army surplus blankets, new and old. The purpose of this blanket is to keep in my car should it not start one night, and I need to wait for AAA in the commuter parking lot. Well, I chose wisely. The blanket is heavy duty, and well made. And essentially no smell.
customer_reviews.author: L. Morano

customer_reviews.title: Atypical ATV cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought to cover up my ATV in the barn, to keep snow, hay, cats off the seat. I fold it over to make a warm seat to go out and do chores, then unfold it back over the engine and it keeps some of the heat in for a while. Love the brown color and how it holds up to snow and ranch work. Also love that it's not so expensive I feel a need to baby it. Just a good useful wool blanket, will probably buy a few more for the ranch.
customer_reviews.author: CO College Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great valued, quality wool blanket! I keep this in my car and often use this when i go winter camping and need a bit of extra warmth on top of my sleeping bag. I recently visited the Smoky's and used this during the night when it dropped below 30. My sleeping bag was rated for 35 degrees, but I felt cold. So i added this layer and it kept me warm! I've actually decided to start putting national park patches on the blanket.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ventures

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: They are woven (not pressed like felt) so you can use them for improvised litters. They're cheaper than decorated wool blankets *cough*Pendleton*cough* They're not ugly so my wife doesn't mind having them on the sofas. I also like they come in different weights for different seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Hans L.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, soft and warm blanket. Washed it on gentle cycle and cold water. Dried on gentle cycle and it is very soft with no itch.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Tarnowski

customer_reviews.title: Decent blanket
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Not the thickest of blankets but fairly warm. Not the softest, but not itchy or scratchy either. I plan on using this blanket for some fall camping.
customer_reviews.author: ChozenOne

customer_reviews.title: A great blanket for use as an outdoor lap blanket
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to use as lap blankets when sitting outside during the colder months on the Oregon coast. The blankets are perfect for this purpose--good weight, great size, dark brown color. A bit of off-gassing was noticeable when I opened the plastic wrappings, but this already has reduced after airing them out. I do not expect that to be a problem for their intended use. I already have one of these in my vehicle as an emergency blanket as well. Quite good product for a really good price.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that will last.
customer_reviews.text: I am with Warm Up Veterans, I started “WUV” last year and purchased from a different vendor and thankfully I found EKTOS. EKTOS blankets are superior from the last vendor I used. 80% wool, I purchased 60 blankets and I need more. These blankets are soft and heavy and individuality packaged and I pleased beyond measure with this product. My blankets go to Veterans who are homeless or are going into transitional housing to help stabilize their lives. My initiative is to go Nationwide with “WUV” to help my brothers and sisters in need of some warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Cazm

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy. Will be great this winter. Fire retardant super warm in the cold. Just returned from five nights in freezing temperatures never got chilled. Excellent blanket
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect use
customer_reviews.text: The blankets are perfect for what my grandchildren needed. They needed to bring a small Wool blanket to school to sit on for a weekly outdoor activity. The blanket is just the right size, warmth & durability needed. The cost was very reasonable. Once they no longer need them outside for school they can use them at home during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn V

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for the money!  An honest and rugged wool blanket
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these wool blankets and for the price they actually exceeded my expectations. A little embarrassed to admit it but I bought them for my two dogs but almost kept them for people. But the dogs won out and they love their warm and thickness. I haven't washed them but they don't have the usual fuzz that cheap wool blankets usually do. The kind that comes off wash after wash after wash. They wouldn't be soft enough to be right next to your face but should be great if you don't have super sensitive skin. In short, these blankets are well worth the price. They won't let you down and I will buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product 5 stars+
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a warm, comfy blanket like the old military blankets I had in the service and found it. This blanket for the money is the best deal on the internet, in fact, I bought two. It is perfect for the chilly nights when we turn down the temperature in the bedroom and like the weight and comfy feel. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Brntroutguy

customer_reviews.title: Warm but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Only had this blanket a week, ordered it on 1/15/19, delivered 1/18/19 and the material has separated, and its not even where it would be stressed! Other than that its a very warm blanket!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a bed roll
customer_reviews.text: The blanket has a dense weave and being primarily wool it should keep me warm even if wet. There isn't much loft and that allows it to be rolled up tightly for a bed roll, which is the purpose I had in mind when I bought it. It appears to be sturdy and should serve me for years. It has a bit of a chemical smell but it dissipates when aired out.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: will bring back memories for the vets
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the higher quality wool blankets. The odor is minimal and will dissipate over time especially if you air it out. Good for camping, emergency use, and just to keep in the car. If you're a veteran and are nostalgic about sleeping under these blankets in good times and bad, get one. The color isn't quite olive drab, but close enough.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzy logic

customer_reviews.title: Wooly wooly, wooly wooly, wooly wooly...
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival I washed both blankets in cold water and added extra fabric softener for the wooly smell. When I removed them from the dryer the lint trap looked like a murdered chinchilla. The lint and lint balls aside the blanket is warm and soft. My wife does not normally like wool and has stolen the second one from me. Overall a very good product, wish it came in red or blue.
customer_reviews.author: R Barton

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am sadly disappointed is this blanket. It is not even close to being the same texture as wool. It is so thin if you hold it up and pull a little you can see the light coming through. I am very disappointed and probably will be asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Guida

customer_reviews.title: Run away!
customer_reviews.text: Very itchy / scratchy. Cheaply made and not 100% wool. DO NOT attempt to wash or dry these blankets in your own machines. The produce a dangerous amount of lint and you’ll ruin your equipment and whatever room that equipment is in. Terrible product. Go to a military surplus store for wool blankets.
customer_reviews.author: JBUICE

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket for the price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these to use as covers for the sofas in our RV to protect the leather from use and pets. We had been using 2 fleece blankets that were way too slick and constantly needed to be tucked in and straightened. When these arrived I instantly liked the feel, not super rough and thicker than I expected. We folded each one in half and tucked the edges along the back and sides of sofas. We both like the way it stays in place better than the fleece blankets and they have a really great feel and look much nicer. I think the wear on these will also be much better. Excellent purchase for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great buy everybody needs one
customer_reviews.text: Very nice blanket. Everyone needs one of these, could save your life.there is a reason, heavy as wool blankets are, solders have been bringing them to battle for milenia. They stay warm when wet, are mildly fire resistant so name a few pluses. For the price this is a huge blanket. Great buy, plus its not too itchy! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Cat cover and warm up
customer_reviews.text: I have a leather recliner and a cat. I have had a number of throws that I covered my chair with to keep the cat nails from putting holes in the leather. The blanket is much better and more durable than a throw. Color is great with my chair and warm while reading of watching TV. The cat thinks it is a wonderful place to sleep at night. We're both happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grizzell

customer_reviews.title: Washes up nicely without any pilling up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very big and very well made blanket ! I bought this to take camping but I have since decided to keep this one for our bed as it is such a nice weight for the fall and winter without being itchy ! I had been looking for one similar for years like the military used to issue and luckily I found this company ! I am a huge fan and will be making many more purchases for gifts for my family! Thank you for offering such quality while still being very affordable!
customer_reviews.author: TLT

customer_reviews.title: Needs washed first
customer_reviews.text: Butter for my mom since she gets cold a lot, felt a little rough so she washed it followed the directions that were on the blanket. When she took it out of the washer it look like somebody shaved the cat we dried it and check for holes and everything, everything was fine on the blanket I just had a ton of excess lint and stuff on it she is totally satisfied with how it is now though
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Warm, heavy blanket.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wool blanket. This isn't near as scratchy as the wool blankets that I remember from my youth. It's nice and heavy. We bought this for when our power goes out and will use it in our travel trailer when camping when it's colder. We anticipate buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rural Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hey Let Go Of My Blankie
customer_reviews.text: I bought a two. Love these blankets when itsvreally cold. Keep one in the car for emergencies. I used to have a similar sized/color blanket when I was in the military and missed it for the utility. They seem a bit thin but are surprisingly effective and for real wool its hard to beat the price
customer_reviews.author: icarusdieduick

customer_reviews.title: Feels nice and soft, great size. I'm happy with this blanket.
customer_reviews.text: This feels very nice and soft. And it's a good size, covers me nicely. I did wash it as per their instructions. Then I put in the dryer, again following their instructions. There was a massive amount of lint, so much that I had to clean the filter twice. Not sure if I'd run it thru the dryer again, maybe just lay it across the bed under a ceiling fan to dry next time.
customer_reviews.author: Woolval

customer_reviews.title: Warm...awesome
customer_reviews.text: This blanket has been on countless camping trips and like a good wool blanket, it has only gotten better with use. Still thick and sturdy, yet has softened up wonderfully. As warm, if not warmer, as would expect for an 80/20 blend. Quality exceeds the price, a great blanket.
customer_reviews.author: BradH8

customer_reviews.title: I love wool
customer_reviews.text: All you hear is complaints from grown adults about how itchy wool is, give me a break. Wool my friend is what keeps you from literally freezing to death and there are all types of wool and I am loving this one, can't wait to go camping with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great blankets
customer_reviews.text: I received my blankets today and they don't have an awful chemical smell like some people say. It does have a scent of lanolin but its very mild. I put them out in the rain to "wash" them and will hang dry them after the rain. These are great blankets and im ordering more. I hope this helps some of you who are on the fence about buying them. Don't machine wash them and they won't shed. Great blankets for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Mpd

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this blanket. I have a dark brown interior in my Lexus Sport Utility and I keep it folded in the back of my car and periodically use it as a moving blanket. I am an interior designer and frequently haul things that are delicate. I was using a standard blue moving blanket in my other car...tacky! I ordered this one to match my new car’s interior and it’s perfect. It is an excellent weight for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Greene

customer_reviews.title: Jury's still out on this blanket.
customer_reviews.text: It isn't made well. The side were unraveling. Wool...that's a stretch. Warm... maybe? It's not soft and it smells of chemicals. I washed it and hung it to dry but still a strong unpleasant smell. I have it in my trunk for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: warm blanket
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is very warm in cold weather. I use it when the nights drop below 10 degrees and my house becomes drafty. It helps me retain enough body heat when my regular blankets fail me
customer_reviews.author: The master dude

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, nice and warm
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, light weight and very warm blanket that can easily wrap two with some room to spare! In front of the fire it's almost too warm but not too cozy! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. S. Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket!
customer_reviews.text: This blanket feels like it’s gonna last.. it’s thick but not so much so it will be too heavy, but enough you know that it will keep you warm and dry. I will update when I use it, but for now it’s rolled up in my tarp waiting to go camping!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jo

customer_reviews.title: Nice, Durable Blanket
customer_reviews.text: It might seem ironic, but I use this blanket in the summertime. I like the color, and the length is quite sufficient, even if you like to pull the blanket up over your head. Some of the other reviews commented on the smell, but it seem to me to be the expected odor of natural wool, which has dissipated over about 2 months without washing.
customer_reviews.author: grateful1

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. A little thinner than I expected but I suppose thicker would cost twice as much. We live in Colorado and keep one in our vehicle for emergencies. The smell is apparently common to wool and honestly was much better after washing with natural fabric softener.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Blanket
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a wool blanket before. I did read several reviews about the smell and how to care for them so I knew what to expect. I think this is a good quality blanket for a good price. Planning to buy one for my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go camping in the fall/winter with, but I didn’t want to spend a lot on a blanket that was going to get plenty abused but still wanted wool. Great product for the money. I read reviews that the blanket smelled bad after being washed but it still smelled like wool to me. Nothing unusual or offensive smelling and I have a very sensitive sense of smell. Maybe the other people just don’t realize what wool smells like. Some reviews said it shed a lot but it’s wool. There’s always going to be some shedding with wool, but my blanket shed very little if any at all after the first wash.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Great Wool Blanket
customer_reviews.text: For the price, great warmth, quality, and size. I washed on cold and delicate/cold cycle with Kookaburra wash with lanolin. Machine dry on low heat. Will shed a little (about a handful which is normal for these type blankets) but super soft afterwards. If your blanket is shedding large, dog sized clumps....you're doing something wrong. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: PA Mountains

customer_reviews.title: This wool blanket gives me enough space between my skin and the mattress to stay more comfortable! Quality of blanket appears to be good
customer_reviews.text: Have one of those space foam mattresses and would wake up perspiring due to the space foam not breathing. This wool blanket gives me enough space between my skin and the mattress to stay more comfortable! Quality of blanket appears to be good, and seems like it should hold up for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Palm Harbor Appraiser

customer_reviews.title: Great more modern take on a classic military blanket!
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected and more. Warm AF, but also light and easy to pack in a ruck, big out bag or stow away. Softer than the original wool as well. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. Both were well made. Had one dry cleaned and it shrank by couple inches. So I did not dry clean the other. The care tags says wash in cold water, but it requires a large washer to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Print Is Alive

customer_reviews.title: Warm and not stinky
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is so good! It is warm, and does not have any odor. It is thick but not too thick and big enough for two people. I will order more of these for our cabin. I think it only comes in brown in the 80% wool though. I hope more colors become available. Also, the price for the quality of this blanket is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: rsvkav

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite impressed by the overall quality of this blanket. Compared to the 100% wool army surplus one I keep in my car it feels a bit rougher on the skin and somewhat less pliable, but I imagine that will improve with wear and wash. Color and stitching are well done and matched up to the pictures provided, and the overall construction appears to be quite solid. After having used it on damp grass this past 4th of July I can confirm it both adequately repels water and moisture and does a good job of insulting one from the ground. Overall an excellent purchase for the price in my opinion; would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost option for a wool blanket
customer_reviews.text: No, it doesn't have a neat design, but for staying warm and comfortable, this is an awesome blanket. The burn resistance makes it great around the fire, and the natural water resistance will keep you warm, even if it's a bit wet. Great for bushcrafters and campers.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket
customer_reviews.text: I planned on putting these in the trunk of my car in case of emergency. It was nice enough that I tossed one over my bed; it is a quite warm blanket. I didn't notice any unusual smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blanket. The only issue I have is that since I got a chance to get this one home and evaluate it, they have been out of stock and I can’t order more.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph  Litwiller

customer_reviews.title: multipurpose, great for covering gear
customer_reviews.text: great investment and very multi-purpose. stays in the car, covers gear in the back...also functions as a blanket for cold nights camping, or just being outside when its cold. even used it as a towel to dry my car once...very very warm, very multipurpose. does its main job, which is covering up gear in the trunk very well....good color that blends in with a grey interior.
customer_reviews.author: Iryn Robben

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this blanket.
customer_reviews.text: I like wool Blankets. I have slept with this blanket quite a bit and it has not made me itch one time. The blanket is thin so it is not to hot. If more were in stock, I buy more. Very happy with this blanket :)
customer_reviews.author: Hoo Poo

customer_reviews.title: Great value blanket
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is plenty warm and plenty large for most purposes. It's an appropriate size to fit on a full-sized bed. I don't find it itchy, but children or those with sensitive skin may want a layer in between. No untoward smells, only a faint woolen scent. If you're worried about this only being 80% wool, consider that you could buy two of these 80% ones for the price of one 100% wool from EKTOS.
customer_reviews.author: threetoast

customer_reviews.title: It will keep you warm.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blanket for the guest room after spending the night in there and freezing. It kept me warm and is just what I needed. As some reviews noted, there was a bit of an odor, but laundering it was all that was needed. But do check the lint screen often. Overall a good value that should last.
customer_reviews.author: Lifi

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional warmth
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package this blanket is good. On the bed at night it feels good as you are under it. Keeps me toasty warm on these cold Minnesota nights. No cold spots by my feet, big enough to cover the whole bed and in the morning it is still in place. Great value, wonderful blanket.
customer_reviews.author: David Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Solid Blanket
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed. No smell or issues with a greasy feel. Lighter than I expected it to be, and works as intended. I keep this in my car for emergencies or the occasional outdoor event/game/activity. I haven't tried to wash or dry the thing yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The blanket became nice fluffy after washing and rinsing it with the "warm" cycles of the washing machine (I line-dried it). The blanket feels warm and cozy - I use it every day - So much satisfaction for such a low price! Thank you ~
customer_reviews.author: i martinkat

customer_reviews.title: Great for cold camping.
customer_reviews.text: Nice blanket, great for cold weather camping or emergency situations. Even when it is a little damp it works very well too keep you warm. Great insulation.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Buying Stuff

customer_reviews.title: NOT US MILITARY QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is NOT the quality that i expected. I washed it twice and dried it ( on low temp setting) and it shed like crazy, all over the place. It has stabilized i hope. It is warm ( used indoors). I would say that it is probably worth $14 (NOT $27)
customer_reviews.author: Blottman

customer_reviews.title: It is absolutely wonderful. It's well made
customer_reviews.text: This blanket far, far, far exceeded my expectations. It is absolutely wonderful. It's well made, heavy, and while it's 80% wool, it is still very soft. It is exactly what I wanted and needed. I am tempted to buy another just because it is such good quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Sanders, author of the Amazon Bestselling Memoir: A Matter of Panache

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality & price = value!
customer_reviews.text: The blanket is incredibly warm, especially for the weight. It is HUGE but weighs around 4#. Being that it is wool, I was expecting it to be scratchy and uncomfortable. Quite the opposite. The blanket is soft, rugged, and folds easily for smaller spaces. Would - and probably will - buy another!
customer_reviews.author: J. Berman

customer_reviews.title: but it looks warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what people are talking about with the scent of the blanket...it smells fairly nuetral and there is no fowl odors coming from it in my smoke free home. I haven't cozied up in it yet, but it looks warm and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Comfy camping blanket for two
customer_reviews.text: I used this blanket on a primitive camping trip. At first I was a little reluctant to haul it around because it’s not exactly lightweight. At 4 AM when it was 44 degrees and our sleeping bags weren’t cutting it I pulled the blanket out and covered myself and my son and it warmed us up perfectly. I’m very happy with this blanket. It does have a slight chemical smell fresh out of the bag, but that fades quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is awesome compared to the junk in the stores this is a fantastic bargain wool is softer than expected can't wait for that first cold night
customer_reviews.author: arthur kennedy

customer_reviews.title: A great blanket.
customer_reviews.text: I got this blanket to use as a renaissance cloak but it will be used for other thing too. It is large enough to cover a twin bed. It is heavy and warm, perfect for those chilly times. Surprisingly soft. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen McNew

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: the price and quality were fantastic.no smell,Soft to the touch and comfortably warm.Purchased to make a warm liner for my Anorak shell jacket,machine washed on delicate with downy blossom and it smells great,Minimal to no shedding in washer or dryer which was at low heat delicate....great value....just purchased another one for home use on the couch
customer_reviews.author: Jay "bird"

customer_reviews.title: D.O.C. approved
customer_reviews.text: this blanket is for my son, who is incarcerated. It fits all of the D.O.C. requirements. He us very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: pat young

customer_reviews.title: Nice as long as you never wash it
customer_reviews.text: its just okay. i really wanted to like it more. If you wash it don't put it in the dryer. And try to never wash it either.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Good value and larger than most at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Good value and larger than most at this price point. I’m using this as a sofa cover. No smell. Edges stitched. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GearGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, no downsides.
customer_reviews.text: Light-weight, tight-knit, no odor, no fraying or fuzz. The dark brown color is what I expected from the Amazon listing. I will not machine wash it or dry it.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Very warm
customer_reviews.text: Very warm When we first took out of the package there was a chemical smell. Have to assume that was part of the treatment process. It has gone away. We used for a football game and it was great.
customer_reviews.author: PAR

customer_reviews.title: Great blanket. Person whom I bought it for loves it
customer_reviews.text: This blanket is unbelievably soft and warm. Great for camping. Will definitely buy more in different colors.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great value.  Smells just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I see or smell nothing wrong at all with this blanket. It's a very good thickness and seems well stitched. Right out of the bag I gave it a sniff. No weird smells at all. Smells like you'd expect of a wool product. I'm just airing it out a few days and putting it right to use this weekend for a mid-30 degree forecasted night of camping here in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia. It's gonna do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: GT FRancis

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my son for his birthday. He's planning a camping trip and says they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Hurst

customer_reviews.title: I haven't seen to many wool blankets but of the ones I've seen this is by far the best quality. I bought this for a J
customer_reviews.text: Has the look and feel of a quality made blanket. I haven't seen to many wool blankets but of the ones I've seen this is by far the best quality. I bought this for a J.I.C. (just in case) situation, you need 1 or 2 put back for that unexpected guest sleeping on the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Desperado

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a blanket I can trust.
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding wool blanket. I mean it. You want a tough, heavy wool blanket, this is a blanket made of wool, and it's heavy. And tough. Reminds me of my grandma. And staying at my grandmas. I guarantee an Irish nun couldn't poke a cold boney finger through this fella. Get it if ya like reliable old ways.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have not slept with this blanket, i keep it as an emergency blanket in my Jeep. It is very heavy duty and seems great. I actually used it to push a car up a hill with the blanket against my bumper and their car in the snow and blanket was not damaged. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be of good quality. Have not had the chance to really use it being in Florida. Have washed twice to get rid of the fuzz/lint and still need further washings to get the results I'm looking for. Have to clean out the washer and dryer to to extreme lint shed but all in all seems to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Fricker

customer_reviews.title: Good sized
customer_reviews.text: A medium thick wool blanket is the best choice for durabilty and warmth. The best combination of breathability and warmth. A 9-month blanket if you like.
customer_reviews.author: Public Names

customer_reviews.title: Very warm, be cautious when cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: The blanket has a slight smell upon arrival, which was removed with soft shampoo and light dry. It works really well, heavy-ish and warm when needed. Caution is mostly required when washing, meanwhile stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos J. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: These blankets appear to be perfect for their intended purpose for us--emergency blankets for the ...
customer_reviews.text: These blankets appear to be perfect for their intended purpose for us--emergency blankets for the trunk of the car or in case there is a winter power outage at home. Also gave one to a homeless gentleman. The size, weight, and quality seem excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe not the most expensive but . . .
customer_reviews.text: I like my blanket. I washed it and did get a lot of lint in the drier (very low heat) but it helped. It smelled a lot better and I didn't notice much shrinkage. Made it nice and soft.
customer_reviews.author: Carolynn M.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality blanket for a great price
customer_reviews.text: A really nice blanket for an outstanding price. I am using this blanket with my get home bag so I haven't used it. However, I examined the blanket, and it is very nice. Not scratchy at all, nice and big, a medium weight, and the seams are sewn. Doesn't smell either.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Warm and tough!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE these blankets. We bought them for our dog😳. Our dog is a pit bull. She doesn’t like dog beds, and tends to tears them up. These blankets are the same or very similar to what you find in army surplus stores, but much more convenient to find. They keep our dog very cozy on cold nights, and they can take a good deal of abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart B.

customer_reviews.title: Get one!
customer_reviews.text: Cozy, I keep it in the truck for hikes or when I drink too much and need to sleep it off before driving.
customer_reviews.author: @savage_the_wild

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like it. It's warm and well made. I expect to get may years of service out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Sprocket

customer_reviews.title: Nice blanket to have for camping, in vehicle for emergencies or in your emergency disaster kits
customer_reviews.text: Warm blanket. Despite some of the other reviews saying it had a strong odor ..... I opened package and only had a slight manufacturing odor. I immediately placed in the dryer on Low heat with a couple Snuggle sheets for 10 minutes and the odor was basically gone. Nice warm blanket that is of good quality to have for emergencies. In your vehicle, in your emergency go-kits or use for camping. A friend of mine purchased one and she hung hers outside in the sunshine on a semi-breezy day for an hour and the odor basically disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A.

product_meta.title: EKTOS 80% Wool Blanket, Light & Warm 3.7 lbs, Large Washable 66"x90" Size, Perfect for Outdoor Camping, Survival & Emergency Preparedness Use
product_meta.description:
Product Specs
> 80 Percent Wool / 20 Percent Synthetic Fibers
> 3.7 Pounds
> 66 x 90 Inches
> Overlocked Edges
> No Fire Retardant Added
> Machine Launderable
> Made in India

 An Outdoor Essential - From base camp gear to backpacking - hunting, fishing, travel and boating - wool blankets are a timeless necessity. They are also an important part of any survival, bushcraft or emergency prepardness kit

Multipurpose & Practical - Use to keep warm in the cold or for bedding, ground cover, padding or extra winter insulation. Can also be used to create a bed roll or to provide protective shelter from the outside elements. Also a great addition to your sleeping bag when the temperature really drops

 Better than US Military surplus as it's new - be sure to order a spare for your home, RV, cabin, car and truck!
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY - These medium weight woolen blankets are loom woven and have finished edges on all sides to prevent fraying. Ruggedly designed - they are durable and naturally long lasting
EXCEPTIONAL WARMTH - Wool has an excellent warmth to weight ratio, is one of the best natural insulators, effectively regulates body temperature and even continues to provide thermal warmth when wet
COMFORTABLE - Designed to be as soft, non-scratchy and odor free as possible, EKTOS 80 percent wool blankets are also naturally mildew, static and fire resistant

NO FIRE RETARDANT ADDED - Despite wool being naturally fire resistent, many blankets on the market still contain chemical flame retardants. Sleep easy knowing this blanket contains no added fire retardants
WASHABLE - Hand or machine washable, EKTOS wollen blankets are easy to care for

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
